column2: The Runlist
Lines with # are skipped by EUTelescope Processors
RunNumber ist the last 4-6 digits of a lcio run file, leading 0s will be added
FileExtension for Alibava runs is either ped or dat
PedRunNumberFormatted is the 6 digit (!) pedestal run number that will be used
Bonds are the good channels of a sensor, coded:
TelescopeRun is the corresponding telescope run, if more than one, only the first
GearGeoFile is the gear file to be used for this run
Pol is the polarity of the sensor. -1 for p- and y-type, 1 for n-type
Clulimit is the event limit up to which clusters will be read from the telescope

column3: file in the clustering step. If this feature is on (cf. steering file),
this needs to be set < telescope event count to prevent segfaults

column2: Refalign is the higher (p,y-type) or lower (n-type) voltage run with a good

column3: alignment, which can be used as an alternative

column2: Filter2 gives the option to skip filtering in the 2nd clustering step
An empty/not needed field can be skipped, but beware that the commas are needed!
Lines with #! will be read by the ROOT analysis and the information used for
shiny plots! Fields are:
#! ThicknessType Fluence, Rotation°, VoltageV, Temperature°C, CurrentmA,
minX maxX (in mm), mintdc maxtdc (in ns), alignx, aligny, alignz, aligna, alignb,
alignc (in mm / °), uselevel, comments
Assumptions:
column3: 25°, 51° draw same current as 0° run, if it exists

column2: this line for EUTelescope:
